author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: Pictured: chaotic scenes at London stations as Tube strike hits capital
text:
1/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike

Commuters fail to get on a crowded bus outside King's Cross during the Tube strike @JSavageTweets/Twitter 11/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike 
Commuters at London Bridge during the Tube strike @KrisIngham1/Twitter 12/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike 
Commuters at Stratford during the Tube strike @abigailporterxo/Twitter 13/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike 
Commuters battle to get on the DLR from Stratford to Canary Wharf @bradders_xx/Twitter 14/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike 
The queue at Wimbledon station as commuters brave the Tube strike @marcelleau/Twitter 15/15 Chaos as commuters battle to get to work during the Tube strike 
The queue at Hackney Central station as commuters brave the Tube strike @CaramelBear81/Twitter 
These were the chaotic scenes in London as a 24-hour Tube strike hit the capital , with millions of commuters battling to get into work. 
London’s major stations, including King’s Cross, London Bridge, Clapham Junction and Liverpool Street, were brought to a standstill. 
Many disgruntled passengers took to social media to voice their frustration. 
Joey Langran described the scenes at Clapham Junction as “absolutely ridiculous” while Alastair Smyth said it was “utter chaos”. 
Tube workers walked out on strike at 6pm on Sunday for 24 hours. Read more
